events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred at a busy intersection resulting in moderate vehicle damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under auto accident due to involvement of the insured vehicle in a collision.
An agent was assigned to handle the case and coordinate further investigation and documentation from the customer.
The claim was formally acknowledged and the customer was informed about the next steps in the claims process.
The customer was requested to submit police report, photos of damage, and vehicle registration documents for review.
Customer submitted all requested documentation including detailed photographs and the official police accident report.
Investigation was initiated to evaluate the circumstances of the car collision and verify all submitted documents.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the accident details are consistent and claim is valid for processing.
An offer for settlement covering vehicle repairs and other eligible expenses was proposed to the customer.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling process.
The claim was officially approved and authorized to proceed with the payment for repairs and damages.
Payment was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s repair shop and direct compensation account as per the settlement.
After payment issuance, the claim file was closed with confirmation that all procedures were completed to satisfaction.
The case files and documentation were archived securely for future reference and compliance requirements.
